body.p: All the project files are stored in the subversion repository, at http://nemerle.org/svn. You can access them with your web browser or with a subversion client (check http://subversion.tigris.org for further information).
You can fetch nemerle tree using the following command:

This will create a nemerle/ directory (last parameter) below current working directory. You need no password to check out the repository (so-called anonymous read-only access), but you will need it to commit any changes you make.
If you have problems fetching sources this way, e.g. you always get message similar to:
body.code: svn: REPORT request failed on '/svn/!svn/vcc/default' svn: REPORT of '/svn/!svn/vcc/default': 400 Bad Request (http://nemerle.org)
body.p: you might try using one of the following commands to bypass HTTP proxies

You should use entire sentences when writing commit logs. A sentence starts with a capital letter and ends with a full stop. Keep this in mind, as ChangeLog files in releases are automatically generated from commit logs, and should look consistent. Don't use past forms in commit logs. For example write "Add foobar to function baz." instead of "Added foobar to function baz." (which is a common practice).
Decision about the style is up to the maintainer of given module.
Use space before an opening paren in a function call and a type application. Use indentation style shown in the following example:
Set expand tabs option in your editor. ASCII 0x09 are not welcome in sources.

There are some tools you will probably find useful while helping us write all the software and documentation related to the project. We try to keep this list complete and up to date, but there still may be some pieces of software, that we forgot, as it seems natural for us to have it installed.
You need a .NET environment. There are several environments you can find.

ul.li: DotGNU (we haven't yet managed to run ncc.exe with Portable.NET libraries)

body.p: You should get nemerle compiler in the tarball. If you experience any problems with it, or have downloaded sources from subversion repository, use the one from http://nemerle.org/download/ncc-boot.exe.

ispell -d american -h file.xml
or use your favorite development environment to do it for you.

To validate XML syntax use
xmllint --noout --xinclude file.xml
don't use <code> in paragraph text -- use <tt>
